meanings.definition: To examine thoroughly and make necessary repairs or adjustments
meanings.sent1: He overhauls his bicycle every summer to keep it in good condition.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic overhauls the engine of the car to ensure it runs smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a squirrel trying to overhauls a broken nutcracker is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: She overhauls her study routine like a mechanic fine-tuning an engine.
meanings.sent5: Overhauls involve carefully inspecting and fixing every part of a machine.

meanings.definition: A thorough examination and repair of a vehicle or machine
meanings.sent1: The overhauls of the old tractor took several days to complete.
meanings.sent2: The factory scheduled regular overhauls for all their machinery.
meanings.sent3: Seeing a robot perform overhauls on a toy car would be quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The overhauls on the airplane were so extensive, it felt like a complete transformation.
meanings.sent5: Overhauls are essential to keep vehicles and machines in top condition.

meanings.definition: A set of clothing or equipment for a specific purpose, typically work or military use
meanings.sent1: The soldier put on his overhauls before heading out for duty.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new set of overhauls for her gardening work.
meanings.sent3: Wearing overhauls in a fashion show would definitely turn heads.
meanings.sent4: His overhauls were like a suit of armor, protecting him during his dangerous job.
meanings.sent5: The overhauls for the construction workers were durable and practical.
